entities.name: aunt petunia
entities.description: Aunt Petunia is described as bursting into tears and embracing Dudley rather than Harry. She is also mentioned to be sobbing into his chest, indicating her affection for him.

entities.name: hestia jones
entities.description: Hestia Jones is described as giving Aunt Petunia an ap-40 and later expressing indignation at Dudley's statement about Harry. She seems to be a disapproving character.

entities.name: dudley
entities.description: Dudley is described as receiving affection from Aunt Petunia and making a statement about Harry that Hestia Jones finds objectionable. He seems to be the favored child.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as being the subject of Dudley's statement and Aunt Petunia's affection. He also expresses annoyance at his aunt's behavior.

entities.name: uncle vernon
entities.description: Uncle Vernon is described as reappearing and expressing frustration with the family's delay in leaving. He seems to be a strict character.

entities.name: dedalus diggle
entities.description: Dedalus Diggle is described as watching the exchanges between Aunt Petunia and Harry with an air of bemusement. He seems to be a somewhat detached character.

relationships.description: Aunt Petunia shows affection towards Dudley, embracing him and sobbing into his chest.
Hestia Jones expresses disapproval of Aunt Petunia's behavior, specifically her favoritism towards Dudley.
Harry compares himself to Dudley, stating that coming from Dudley is like saying 'I love you'.
